OpenSearch.summary: The OpenSearch description format can be used to describe the web interface of a search engine. This allows a website to describe a search engine for itself, so that a browser or other client application can use that search engine. OpenSearch is supported by (at least) Firefox, Edge, Safari, and Chrome. (See Reference Material for links to other browsers' documentation.)

remarks.para: Firefox also supports additional features not in the OpenSearch standard, such as search suggestions and the <SearchForm> element. This article focuses on creating OpenSearch-compatible search plugins that support these additional Firefox features.
OpenSearch description files can be advertised as described in Autodiscovery of search plugins.

blockquote.para: Warning: OpenSearch plugins can't be uploaded anymore on addons.mozilla.org (AMO). Search engine feature must use WebExtension API with chrome settings in manifest.json file.
